title: How to Make Spicy Pumpkin Soup

steps.headline: Heat oil in a pan on a medium flame.
steps.description: Add onion and garlic and cook and stir until translucent.

steps.headline: Add the potato and the pumpkin and cook, stirring occasionally for a while until potato is golden-brown in colour.
Add the paprika and the rest of the spices and cook until the spices give a wonderful fragrant flavour.
Add the stock and let it boil on a low flame.
steps.description: Cook, covered, 10 minutes and cook, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes, or until pumpkin is tender.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
steps.description: At this point the soup needs to be tasted to check the seasoning.

steps.headline: In a blender, blend soup in batches until smooth.
steps.description: Strain the stock then return to the pan and keep warm over a low heat.

steps.headline: Divide the soup between bowls, season with freshly crushed black pepper.
steps.description: Top with roasted pumpkin seeds and cream. Serve with toast.

text: Heat oil in a pan on a medium flame. Add onion and garlic and cook and stir until translucent. Add the potato and the pumpkin and cook, stirring occasionally for a while until potato is golden-brown in colour.  Add the paprika and the rest of the spices and cook until the spices give a wonderful fragrant flavour.  Add the stock and let it boil on a low flame. Cook, covered, 10 minutes and cook, uncovered, for 15 to 20 minutes, or until pumpkin is tender. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly, about 5 minutes. At this point the soup needs to be tasted to check the seasoning. In a blender, blend soup in batches until smooth. Strain the stock then return to the pan and keep warm over a low heat. Divide the soup between bowls, season with freshly crushed black pepper. Top with roasted pumpkin seeds and cream. Serve with toast.
